      • gcd

        public static java.lang.Integer gcd(int a,
                                    int b)
        Euclidean algorithm is a way to find the greatest common divisor of two positive integers, a and b. The process is based on the observation that, if r is the remainder when a is divided by b, then the common divisors of a and b are the same as the common divisors of b and r.
        Parameters:
        a - Integer a
        b - Integer b
        Returns:
        Returns greatest common denominator
